keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: A glimpse of Abu Zubaydah, whom the Bush administration portrayed as the personification of evil, underscores the travesty at Guantánamo.

headline.main: A Stark Reminder of Guantánamo’s Sins

snippet: A glimpse of Abu Zubaydah, whom the Bush administration portrayed as the personification of evil, underscores the travesty at Guantánamo....
abstract: Editorial revisits case of Abu Zubaydah, held in custody at Guantanamo Bay for more than 14 years and first prisoner to be waterboarded by CIA; Zubaydah is currently making case for his release before panel of government officials; argues hearing is chance for United States to reflect on shameful tactics employed at Guantanamo during years of national panic about terrorism and to re-energize efforts to finally close facility down.
